newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Argentina's Cordoba to auction six mine properties.
newsitem.headline: Argentina's Cordoba to auction six mine properties.

text.p: Argentina's Cordoba province plans to auction off concessions on six mineral exploration properties next April, the province's governor said.

Gov. Ramon Mestre, who was in Sao Paulo at the head of a business delegation, said the properties cover 158,000 hectares (390,000 acres) in the province's northwest region and contain gold, silver and other metals.
The upcoming tender has drawn the interest of major world mining companies, including Anglo-American Corp of South Africa, Australia's Mt. Isa and Canada's Rio Algom Ltd, Mestre said.
"They're very interested in the subject," he told reporters at a working breakfast.
He did not provide base prices or other details on the upcoming tenders.
The provincial government hired French state mining firm Bureau de Recherche Geologique et Minieres (BRGM) to evaluate the mineral potential of properties in northwestern Cordoba, Mestre said.
New mining technology may be able to make old mineral properties in the province once considered uneconomical to mine viable, he added.
